question.text: The denaturation process in Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) does not involve

options.text: breaking of hydrogen bonds of the original DNA double helix
heating of starting solution to <math><msup><mrow><mn>94</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
addition of nucleotides to the primer by DNA polymerase

solution.text:
PCR stands for Polymerase Chain Reaction. In this reaction, gene (segment of DNA) of interest is synthesised in vitro and multiple copies are generated. The main steps of PCR-

Denaturation - where the double-stranded template DNA is heated to separate it into two single strands.

Annealing - where the temperature is lowered to enable the DNA primers to attach to the template DNA.

Extension - where the temperature is raised and the new strand of DNA is made by the Taq polymerase

enzyme. Thus, option C is correct as it is part of extension step and not denaturation.
